PClean is a domain-specific language for dataset cleaning. In the following, I will provide an excerpt of a dataset to be cleaned, as well as a description of errors found in the dataset, and will ask you to write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and its contained errors, which can be run to automatically fix the errors. 
    
Dataset Excerpt:

Error Description: There are typos in the result column. Sometimes the artist_id value is incorrectly reported in 2.2 times the correct unit. Sometimes the age value is incorrectly reported in 10.0 times the correct unit.
    
Given this dataset excerpt and error description, the goal is to write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. 

A good first step is to describe the schema of the dataset, since the structure of the PClean program closely follows the dataset schema. Can you describe the schema of the given dataset, provided the excerpt above?

Yes! The following describes the schema: The schema has 3 tables, which we'll call artist, volume, and music_festival. The table artist has columns artist_id, artist, age, famous_title, and famous_release_date. The table volume has columns volume_id, volume_issue, issue_date, weeks_on_top, song, and volume_artist_id. The table music_festival has columns id, music_festival, date_of_ceremony, category, volume, and result. Finally, volume_artist_id of volume is a foreign key reference to artist_id of artist and volume of music_festival is a foreign key reference to volume_id of volume.

Awesome! Now, based on this schema and the previously provided error description, please write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. Please only include the PClean program in your response, without any preceding or following text.

PClean.@model Music4Model begin
    @class Artist begin
        artist ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:artist])
        famous_title ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:famous_title])
        famous_release_date ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:famous_release_date])
    end

    @class Volume begin
        volume_id ~ Unmodeled()
        volume_issue ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:volume_issue])
        issue_date ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:issue_date])
        weeks_on_top ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:weeks_on_top])
        song ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:song])
        artist ~ Artist
    end

    @class Music_festival begin
        id ~ Unmodeled()
        music_festival ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:music_festival])
        date_of_ceremony ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:date_of_ceremony])
        category ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:category])
        volume ~ Volume
        result ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:result])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        music_festival ~ Music_festival
        @learned avg_age::Dict{String, MeanParameter{28.5, 7.852812659593164}}
        unit_age ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        age_base = avg_age["$(music_festival.volume.artist.artist)_$(music_festival.volume.artist.famous_title)_$(music_festival.volume.artist.famous_release_date)"]
        age ~ TransformedGaussian(age_base, 7.852812659593164/10, unit_age)
        age_corrected = round(unit_age.backward(age))
        result ~ AddTypos(music_festival.result, 2)
    end
end

query = @query Music4Model.Obs [
    artist music_festival.volume.artist.artist
    age age_corrected age
    famous_title music_festival.volume.artist.famous_title
    famous_release_date music_festival.volume.artist.famous_release_date
    volume_issue music_festival.volume.volume_issue
    issue_date music_festival.volume.issue_date
    weeks_on_top music_festival.volume.weeks_on_top
    song music_festival.volume.song
    music_festival music_festival.music_festival
    date_of_ceremony music_festival.date_of_ceremony
    category music_festival.category
    result music_festival.result result
]


observations = [ObservedDataset(query, dirty_table)]
config = PClean.InferenceConfig(5, 2; use_mh_instead_of_pg=true)
@time begin 
    tr = initialize_trace(observations, config);
    run_inference!(tr, config)
end

println(evaluate_accuracy(dirty_table, clean_table, tr.tables[:Obs], query))

Error Description: There are typos in the policy_type_code column. Sometimes the settlements_effective_date value for a given settlement_id value are different across different settlement_amount values, when they should be the same. It should be inferred which of these is correct so all settlement_amount values provide the same information. Sometimes the services_service_id value is incorrectly reported in 100.0 times the correct unit.
    
Given this dataset excerpt and error description, the goal is to write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. 

A good first step is to describe the schema of the dataset, since the structure of the PClean program closely follows the dataset schema. Can you describe the schema of the given dataset, provided the excerpt above?

Yes! The following describes the schema: The schema has 7 tables, which we'll call customers, services, available_policies, customers_policies, first_notification_of_loss, claims, and settlements. The table customers has columns customers_customer_id and customer_name. The table services has columns services_service_id and service_name. The table available_policies has columns available_policies_policy_id, policy_type_code, and customer_phone. The table customers_policies has columns customers_policies_customer_id, customers_policies_policy_id, date_opened, and date_closed. The table first_notification_of_loss has columns first_notification_of_loss_fnol_id, first_notification_of_loss_customer_id, first_notification_of_loss_policy_id, and first_notification_of_loss_service_id. The table claims has columns claims_claim_id, claims_fnol_id, and claims_effective_date. The table settlements has columns settlement_id, settlements_claim_id, settlements_effective_date, and settlement_amount. Finally, customers_policies_customer_id of customers_policies is a foreign key reference to customers_customer_id of customers, customers_policies_policy_id of customers_policies is a foreign key reference to available_policies_policy_id of available_policies, first_notification_of_loss_customer_id of first_notification_of_loss is a foreign key reference to customers_policies_customer_id of customers_policies, first_notification_of_loss_policy_id of first_notification_of_loss is a foreign key reference to customers_policies_policy_id of customers_policies, first_notification_of_loss_service_id of first_notification_of_loss is a foreign key reference to services_service_id of services, claims_fnol_id of claims is a foreign key reference to first_notification_of_loss_fnol_id of first_notification_of_loss, and settlements_claim_id of settlements is a foreign key reference to claims_claim_id of claims.

Awesome! Now, based on this schema and the previously provided error description, please write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. Please only include the PClean program in your response, without any preceding or following text.

PClean.@model InsuranceFnolModel begin
    @class Settlement_amount begin
        settlement_amount ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:settlement_amount])
    end

    @class Settlements begin
        settlement_id ~ Unmodeled()
        claims ~ Claims
        settlements_effective_date ~ TimePrior(swap_possibilities["$(settlement_id)-settlements_effective_date"])
    end

    @class Customers begin
        customers_customer_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customer_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_name])
    end

    @class Services begin
        service_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:service_name])
    end

    @class Available_policies begin
        available_policies_policy_id ~ Unmodeled()
        policy_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:policy_type_code])
        customer_phone ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_phone])
    end

    @class Customers_policies begin
        customers ~ Customers
        available_policies ~ Available_policies
        date_opened ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_opened])
        date_closed ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_closed])
    end

    @class First_notification_of_loss begin
        first_notification_of_loss_fnol_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customers_policies ~ Customers_policies
        services ~ Services
    end

    @class Claims begin
        claims_claim_id ~ Unmodeled()
        first_notification_of_loss ~ First_notification_of_loss
        claims_effective_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:claims_effective_date])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        settlement_amount ~ Settlement_amount
        settlements ~ Settlements
        error_prob_settlement_amount = error_probs[settlement_amount.settlement_amount]
        policy_type_code ~ AddTypos(settlements.claims.first_notification_of_loss.customers_policies.available_policies.policy_type_code, 2)
        settlements_effective_date ~ MaybeSwap(settlements.settlements_effective_date, swap_possibilities["$(settlements.settlement_id)-settlements_effective_date"], error_prob_settlement_amount)
    end
end

query = @query InsuranceFnolModel.Obs [
    customer_name settlements.claims.first_notification_of_loss.customers_policies.customers.customer_name
    service_name settlements.claims.first_notification_of_loss.services.service_name
    policy_type_code settlements.claims.first_notification_of_loss.customers_policies.available_policies.policy_type_code policy_type_code
    customer_phone settlements.claims.first_notification_of_loss.customers_policies.available_policies.customer_phone
    date_opened settlements.claims.first_notification_of_loss.customers_policies.date_opened
    date_closed settlements.claims.first_notification_of_loss.customers_policies.date_closed
    claims_effective_date settlements.claims.claims_effective_date
    settlements_effective_date settlements.settlements_effective_date settlements_effective_date
    settlement_amount settlement_amount.settlement_amount
]

config = PClean.InferenceConfig(5, 2; use_mh_instead_of_pg=true)
@time begin 
    tr = initialize_trace(observations, config);
    run_inference!(tr, config)
end

Yes! The following describes the schema: The schema has 3 tables, which we'll call film, cinema, and schedule. The table film has columns film_id, rank_in_series, number_in_season, title, directed_by, original_air_date, and production_code. The table cinema has columns cinema_id, name, openning_year, capacity, and location. The table schedule has columns schedule_cinema_id, schedule_film_id, date, show_times_per_day, and price. Finally, schedule_film_id of schedule is a foreign key reference to film_id of film and schedule_cinema_id of schedule is a foreign key reference to cinema_id of cinema.

Awesome! Now, based on this schema and the previously provided error description, please write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. Please only include the PClean program in your response, without any preceding or following text.

PClean.@model CinemaModel begin
    @class Price begin
        price ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:price])
    end

    @class Schedule begin
        cinema ~ Cinema
        film ~ Film
        date ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:date])
        show_times_per_day ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:show_times_per_day])
    end

    @class Film begin
        film_id ~ Unmodeled()
        rank_in_series ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:rank_in_series])
        number_in_season ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:number_in_season])
        title ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:title])
        directed_by ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:directed_by])
        original_air_date ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:original_air_date])
        production_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:production_code])
    end

    @class Cinema begin
        cinema_id ~ Unmodeled()
        name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:name])
        openning_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:openning_year])
        capacity ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:capacity])
        location ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:location])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        price ~ Price
        schedule ~ Schedule
        error_prob_price = error_probs[price.price]
        title ~ AddTypos(schedule.film.title, 2)
        show_times_per_day ~ MaybeSwap(schedule.show_times_per_day, swap_possibilities["$(schedule.date)-show_times_per_day"], error_prob_price)
    end
end

query = @query CinemaModel.Obs [
    rank_in_series schedule.film.rank_in_series
    number_in_season schedule.film.number_in_season
    title schedule.film.title title
    directed_by schedule.film.directed_by
    original_air_date schedule.film.original_air_date
    production_code schedule.film.production_code
    name schedule.cinema.name
    openning_year schedule.cinema.openning_year
    capacity schedule.cinema.capacity
    location schedule.cinema.location
    date schedule.date
    show_times_per_day schedule.show_times_per_day show_times_per_day
    price price.price
]

PClean.@model DecorationCompetitionModel begin
    @class College begin
        college_id ~ Unmodeled()

        college_location ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:college_location])

    @class Member begin
        member_id ~ Unmodeled()
        member_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:member_name])
        country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:country])

    @class Round begin
        member ~ Member
        decoration_theme ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:decoration_theme])
        rank_in_round ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:rank_in_round])

        unit_round_id ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        round_id_base = avg_round_id["$(round.decoration_theme)"]
        round_id ~ TransformedGaussian(round_id_base, 0.7071067811865476/10, unit_round_id)
        round_id_corrected = round(unit_round_id.backward(round_id))
    end
end

PClean.@model PhoneMarketModel begin
    @class Phone begin
        name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:name])
        phone_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:phone_id])
        memory_in_g ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:memory_in_g])
        carrier ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:carrier])
        price ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:price])
    end

    @class Market begin
        market_id ~ Unmodeled()
        district ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:district])
        num_of_employees ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:num_of_employees])
        ranking ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:ranking])
    end

    @class Phone_market begin
        market ~ Market
        phone ~ Phone
        num_of_stock ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:num_of_stock])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        phone_market ~ Phone_market
        @learned avg_num_of_shops::Dict{String, MeanParameter{47.666666666666664, 7.094598884597588}}
        unit_num_of_shops ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        num_of_shops_base = avg_num_of_shops["$(phone_market.market.district)"]
        num_of_shops ~ TransformedGaussian(num_of_shops_base, 7.094598884597588/10, unit_num_of_shops)
        num_of_shops_corrected = round(unit_num_of_shops.backward(num_of_shops))
    end
end

PClean.@model StoreProductModel begin
    @class Number_of_product_category begin
        number_of_product_category ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:number_of_product_category])
    end

    @class Store begin
        store_id ~ Unmodeled()
        store_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:store_name])
        type ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:type])
        area_size ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:area_size])
        ranking ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:ranking])
    end

    @class District begin
        district_id ~ Unmodeled()
        district_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:district_name])
        headquartered_city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:headquartered_city])
        city_population ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city_population])
        city_area ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city_area])
    end

    @class Store_product begin
        store ~ Store
        product_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:product_id])
    end

    @class Store_district begin
        store ~ Store
        district ~ District
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        number_of_product_category ~ Number_of_product_category
        store_product ~ Store_product
        store_district ~ Store_district
        error_prob_number_of_product_category = error_probs[number_of_product_category.number_of_product_category]
        ranking ~ MaybeSwap(store_product.store.ranking, swap_possibilities["$(store_product.store.store_name)-ranking"], error_prob_number_of_product_category)
    end
end

PClean.@model StudentAssessmentModel begin
    @class Password begin
        password ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:password])
    end

    @class People begin
        people_person_id ~ Unmodeled()
        first_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:first_name])
        middle_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:middle_name])
        last_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:last_name])
        cell_mobile_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:cell_mobile_number])
        email_address ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:email_address])
        login_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:login_name])
    end

    @class Addresses begin
        line_1 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:line_1])
        line_2 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:line_2])
        city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city])
        zip_postcode ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:zip_postcode])
        state_province_county ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:state_province_county])
        country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:country])
    end

    @class Students begin
        people ~ People
        student_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:student_details])
    end

    @class Courses begin
        courses_course_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:courses_course_id])
        course_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:course_name])
        course_description ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:course_description])
        other_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:other_details])
    end

    @class People_addresses begin
        person_address_id ~ Unmodeled()
        people ~ People
        addresses ~ Addresses
        date_from ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_from])
        date_to ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_to])
    end

    @class Student_course_registrations begin
        students ~ Students
        courses ~ Courses
        registration_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:registration_date])
    end

    @class Student_course_attendance begin
        student_course_registrations ~ Student_course_registrations
        date_of_attendance ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_of_attendance])
    end

    @class Candidates begin
        people ~ People
        candidate_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:candidate_details])
    end

    @class Candidate_assessments begin
        candidates ~ Candidates
        qualification ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:qualification])
        assessment_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:assessment_date])
        asessment_outcome_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:asessment_outcome_code])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        password ~ Password
        people_addresses ~ People_addresses
        student_course_attendance ~ Student_course_attendance
        candidate_assessments ~ Candidate_assessments
        error_prob_password = error_probs[password.password]
        asessment_outcome_code ~ AddTypos(candidate_assessments.asessment_outcome_code, 2)
    end
end

PClean.@model DogKennelsModel begin
    @class Owners_home_phone begin
        owners_home_phone ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_home_phone])
    end

    @class Owners begin
        owners_first_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_first_name])
        owners_last_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_last_name])
        owners_street ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_street])
        owners_city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_city])
        owners_state ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_state])
        owners_zip_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_zip_code])
        owners_email_address ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_email_address])
        owners_cell_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:owners_cell_number])
    end

    @class Breeds begin
        breeds_breed_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:breeds_breed_code])
        breed_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:breed_name])
    end

    @class Sizes begin
        sizes_size_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:sizes_size_code])
        size_description ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:size_description])
    end

    @class Treatment_types begin
        treatment_types_treatment_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:treatment_types_treatment_type_code])
        treatment_type_description ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:treatment_type_description])
    end

    @class Dogs begin
        dogs_dog_id ~ Unmodeled()
        owners ~ Owners
        abandoned_yes_or_no ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:abandoned_yes_or_no])
        breeds ~ Breeds
        sizes ~ Sizes
        name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:name])
        age ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:age])
        date_of_birth ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_of_birth])
        gender ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:gender])
        weight ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:weight])
        date_arrived ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_arrived])
        date_adopted ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_adopted])
        date_departed ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_departed])
    end

    @class Professionals begin
        role_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:role_code])
        professionals_first_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_first_name])
        professionals_street ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_street])
        professionals_city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_city])
        professionals_state ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_state])
        professionals_zip_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_zip_code])
        professionals_last_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_last_name])
        professionals_email_address ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_email_address])
        professionals_home_phone ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_home_phone])
        professionals_cell_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:professionals_cell_number])
    end

    @class Treatments begin
        treatment_id ~ Unmodeled()
        dogs ~ Dogs
        professionals ~ Professionals
        treatment_types ~ Treatment_types
        date_of_treatment ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_of_treatment])
        cost_of_treatment ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:cost_of_treatment])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        owners_home_phone ~ Owners_home_phone
        treatments ~ Treatments
        error_prob_owners_home_phone = error_probs[owners_home_phone.owners_home_phone]
        owners_cell_number ~ MaybeSwap(treatments.dogs.owners.owners_cell_number, swap_possibilities["$(treatments.dogs.owners.owners_first_name)-owners_cell_number"], error_prob_owners_home_phone)
    end
end

PClean.@model Music1Model begin
    @class Releasedate begin
        releasedate ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:releasedate])
    end

    @class Song begin
        song_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:song_name])
        artist ~ Artist
        song_country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:song_country])
        files ~ Files
        genre ~ Genre
        song_rating ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:song_rating])
        languages ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:languages])
    end

    @class Genre begin
        genre_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:genre_name])
        genre_rating ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:genre_rating])
        most_popular_in ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:most_popular_in])
    end

    @class Artist begin
        artist_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:artist_name])
        artist_country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:artist_country])
        gender ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:gender])
        genre ~ Genre
    end

    @class Files begin
        files_song_id ~ Unmodeled()
        artist ~ Artist
        file_size ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:file_size])
        duration ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:duration])
        formats ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:formats])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        releasedate ~ Releasedate
        song ~ Song
        error_prob_releasedate = error_probs[releasedate.releasedate]
        genre_name ~ AddTypos(song.artist.genre.genre_name, 2)
        languages ~ MaybeSwap(song.languages, swap_possibilities["$(song.song_rating)-languages"], error_prob_releasedate)
        @learned avg_resolution::Dict{String, MeanParameter{658.0, 325.31420708806024}}
        unit_resolution ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        resolution_base = avg_resolution["$(song.song_name)_$(song.song_artist_name)_$(song.song_country)_$(song.genre_is)_$(song.languages)"]
        resolution ~ TransformedGaussian(resolution_base, 325.31420708806024/10, unit_resolution)
        resolution_corrected = round(unit_resolution.backward(resolution))
    end
end

A good first step is to describe the schema of the dataset, since the structure of the PClean program closely follows the dataset schema. Can you describe the schema of the given dataset, provided the excerpt above?

Yes! The following describes the schema: The schema has 4 tables, which we'll call city, farm, farm_competition, and competition_record. The table city has columns city_id, official_name, status, area_km_2, population, and census_ranking. The table farm has columns farm_id, farm_year, total_horses, working_horses, total_cattle, oxen, bulls, cows, pigs, and sheep_and_goats. The table farm_competition has columns farm_competition_competition_id, farm_competition_year, theme, host_city_id, and hosts. The table competition_record has columns competition_record_competition_id, competition_record_farm_id, and rank. Finally, host_city_id of farm_competition is a foreign key reference to city_id of city, competition_record_competition_id of competition_record is a foreign key reference to farm_competition_competition_id of farm_competition, and competition_record_farm_id of competition_record is a foreign key reference to farm_id of farm.

Awesome! Now, based on this schema and the previously provided error description, please write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. Please only include the PClean program in your response, without any preceding or following text.

PClean.@model FarmModel begin
    @class Working_horses begin
        working_horses ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:working_horses])
    end

    @class Farm begin
        farm_id ~ Unmodeled()
        farm_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:farm_year])
        total_horses ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:total_horses])
        total_cattle ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:total_cattle])
        oxen ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:oxen])
        bulls ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:bulls])
        cows ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:cows])
        pigs ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:pigs])
        sheep_and_goats ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:sheep_and_goats])
    end

    @class City begin
        city_id ~ Unmodeled()
        official_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:official_name])
        status ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:status])
        area_km_2 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:area_km_2])
        population ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:population])
        census_ranking ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:census_ranking])
    end

    @class Farm_competition begin
        farm_competition_competition_id ~ Unmodeled()
        farm_competition_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:farm_competition_year])
        theme ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:theme])
        city ~ City
        hosts ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:hosts])
    end

    @class Competition_record begin
        farm_competition ~ Farm_competition
        farm ~ Farm
        rank ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:rank])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        working_horses ~ Working_horses
        competition_record ~ Competition_record
        error_prob_working_horses = error_probs[working_horses.working_horses]
        sheep_and_goats ~ MaybeSwap(competition_record.farm.sheep_and_goats, swap_possibilities["$(competition_record.farm.bulls)-sheep_and_goats"], error_prob_working_horses)
        hosts ~ AddTypos(competition_record.farm_competition.hosts, 2)
    end
end

PClean.@model SolvencyIiModel begin
    @class Addresses begin
        addresses_address_id ~ Unmodeled()
        address_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:address_details])
    end

    @class Locations begin
        locations_location_id ~ Unmodeled()
        locations_other_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:locations_other_details])
    end

    @class Products begin
        products_product_id ~ Unmodeled()
        product_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:product_type_code])
        product_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:product_name])
        product_price ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:product_price])
    end

    @class Parties begin
        parties_party_id ~ Unmodeled()
        party_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:party_details])
    end

    @class Finances begin
        finances_other_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:finances_other_details])
    end

    @class Events begin
        addresses ~ Addresses
        channel_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:channel_id])
        event_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:event_type_code])
        finances ~ Finances
        locations ~ Locations
    end

    @class Products_in_events begin
        product_in_event_id ~ Unmodeled()
        events ~ Events
        products ~ Products
    end

    @class Parties_in_events begin
        parties ~ Parties
        events ~ Events
        role_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:role_code])
    end

    @class Agreements begin
        document_id ~ Unmodeled()
        events ~ Events
    end

    @class Assets_in_events begin
        asset_id ~ Unmodeled()
        events ~ Events
    end

    @class Obs begin
        products_in_events ~ Products_in_events
        parties_in_events ~ Parties_in_events
        agreements ~ Agreements
        assets_in_events ~ Assets_in_events
        party_details ~ AddTypos(parties_in_events.parties.party_details, 2)
    end
end

PClean.@model SwimmingModel begin

        city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city])
        country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:country])
        opening_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:opening_year])
    end

    @class Swimmer begin
        swimmer_id ~ Unmodeled()
        swimmer_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:swimmer_name])
        nationality ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:nationality])
        meter_100 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:meter_100])
        meter_200 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:meter_200])
        meter_300 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:meter_300])
        meter_400 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:meter_400])
        meter_500 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:meter_500])
        meter_600 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:meter_600])
        meter_700 ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:meter_700])
        time ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:time])
    end

    @class Event begin
        event_id ~ Unmodeled()
        event_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:event_name])
        stadium ~ Stadium
        year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:year])
    end

    @class Record begin
        record_id ~ Unmodeled()
        result ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:result])
        swimmer ~ Swimmer
        event ~ Event
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        record ~ Record
        error_prob_stadium_id = error_probs[stadium_id.stadium_id]
        city ~ MaybeSwap(record.event.stadium.city, swap_possibilities["$(record.event.stadium.opening_year)-city"], error_prob_stadium_id)
    end
end

PClean.@model Flight2Model begin
    @class Country_abbrev begin
        country_abbrev ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:country_abbrev])
    end

    @class Airports begin
        city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city])
        airport_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airport_code])
        airport_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airport_name])
        country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:country])
    end

    @class Flights begin
        airline ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airline])
        flight_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:flight_number])
        airports ~ Airports
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        country_abbrev ~ Country_abbrev
        flights ~ Flights
        error_prob_country_abbrev = error_probs[country_abbrev.country_abbrev]
        city ~ AddTypos(flights.airports.city, 2)
        airport_code ~ MaybeSwap(flights.airports.airport_code, swap_possibilities["$(flights.airports.country)-airport_code"], error_prob_country_abbrev)
        airport_name ~ AddTypos(flights.airports.airport_name, 2)
    end
end

PClean.@model Manufactory1Model begin

        products_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:products_name])
    end

    @class Products begin
        products_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:products_code])
        price ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:price])
        manufacturers ~ Manufacturers
    end

    @class Manufacturers begin
        manufacturers_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:manufacturers_name])
        headquarter ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:headquarter])
        founder ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:founder])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        products_name ~ Products_name
        products ~ Products
        error_prob_products_name = error_probs[products_name.products_name]
        @learned avg_manufacturers_code::Dict{String, MeanParameter{3.5, 1.8708286933869707}}
        unit_manufacturers_code ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        manufacturers_code_base = avg_manufacturers_code["$(products.manufacturers.manufacturers_name)_$(products.manufacturers.headquarter)_$(products.manufacturers.founder)"]
        manufacturers_code ~ TransformedGaussian(manufacturers_code_base, 1.8708286933869707/10, unit_manufacturers_code)
        manufacturers_code_corrected = round(unit_manufacturers_code.backward(manufacturers_code))
        @learned avg_revenue::Dict{String, MeanParameter{105.0, 60.909769331364245}}
        unit_revenue ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        revenue_base = avg_revenue["$(products.manufacturers.manufacturers_name)_$(products.manufacturers.headquarter)_$(products.manufacturers.founder)"]
        revenue ~ TransformedGaussian(revenue_base, 60.909769331364245/10, unit_revenue)
        revenue_corrected = round(unit_revenue.backward(revenue))
        products_code ~ MaybeSwap(products.products_code, swap_possibilities["$(products.price)-products_code"], error_prob_products_name)
    end
end

PClean.@model Flight4Model begin
    @class Source_airport begin
        source_airport ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:source_airport])
    end

    @class Routes begin
        route_id ~ Unmodeled()
        airports ~ Airports
        destination_airport ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:destination_airport])
        airlines ~ Airlines
        airline ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airline])
        code_share ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:code_share])
    end

    @class Airports begin
        airport_id ~ Unmodeled()
        airports_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airports_name])
        city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city])
        airports_country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airports_country])
        x ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:x])
        y ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:y])
        airports_iata ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airports_iata])
        airports_icao ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airports_icao])
    end

    @class Airlines begin
        airlines_airline_id ~ Unmodeled()
        airlines_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airlines_name])
        airlines_iata ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airlines_iata])
        airlines_icao ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airlines_icao])
        call_sign ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:call_sign])
        airlines_country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:airlines_country])
        active ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:active])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        source_airport ~ Source_airport
        routes ~ Routes
        error_prob_source_airport = error_probs[source_airport.source_airport]
        @learned avg_elevation::Dict{String, MeanParameter{428.8125, 367.24727704912937}}
        unit_elevation ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        elevation_base = avg_elevation["$(routes.airports.airports_name)_$(routes.airports.city)_$(routes.airports.airports_country)_$(routes.airports.airports_iata)_$(routes.airports.airports_icao)"]
        elevation ~ TransformedGaussian(elevation_base, 367.24727704912937/10, unit_elevation)
        elevation_corrected = round(unit_elevation.backward(elevation))
        airlines_country ~ AddTypos(routes.airlines.airlines_country, 2)
    end
end

The table student has columns student_id, last_name, first_name, age, sex, major, advisor, and city_code. The table has_pet has columns has_pet_student_id and has_pet_pet_id. The table pets has columns pets_pet_id, pet_type, pet_age, and weight. PClean.@model Pets1Model begin
    @class Pet_type begin
        pet_type ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:pet_type])
    end

    @class Pets begin
        pets_pet_id ~ Unmodeled()
        weight ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:weight])
    end

    @class Student begin
        student_id ~ Unmodeled()
        last_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:last_name])
        first_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:first_name])
        sex ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:sex])
        major ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:major])
        advisor ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:advisor])
        city_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city_code])
    end

    @class Has_pet begin
        student ~ Student
        pets ~ Pets
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        pet_type ~ Pet_type
        has_pet ~ Has_pet
        error_prob_pet_type = error_probs[pet_type.pet_type]
        @learned avg_age::Dict{String, MeanParameter{18.5, 0.7071067811865476}}
        unit_age ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        age_base = avg_age["$(has_pet.student.last_name)_$(has_pet.student.first_name)_$(has_pet.student.sex)_$(has_pet.student.city_code)"]
        age ~ TransformedGaussian(age_base, 0.7071067811865476/10, unit_age)
        age_corrected = round(unit_age.backward(age))
        @learned avg_pet_age::Dict{String, MeanParameter{2.0, 1.0}}
        unit_pet_age ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        pet_age_base = avg_pet_age["$(has_pet.pets.pet_type)"]
        pet_age ~ TransformedGaussian(pet_age_base, 1.0/10, unit_pet_age)
        pet_age_corrected = round(unit_pet_age.backward(pet_age))
    end
end

The table dorm_amenity has columns dorm_amenity_amenity_id and amenity_name. The table has_amenity has columns has_amenity_dorm_id and has_amenity_amenity_id. The table lives_in has columns lives_in_student_id, lives_in_dorm_id, and room_number. Finally, lives_in_student_id of lives_in is a foreign key reference to student_id of student, lives_in_dorm_id of lives_in is a foreign key reference to dorm_id of dorm, has_amenity_dorm_id of has_amenity is a foreign key reference to dorm_id of dorm, and has_amenity_amenity_id of has_amenity is a foreign key reference to dorm_amenity_amenity_id of dorm_amenity.

PClean.@model Dorm1Model begin
    @class Student begin
        student_id ~ Unmodeled()
        last_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:last_name])
        first_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:first_name])
        sex ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:sex])
        major ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:major])
        advisor ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:advisor])
        city_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city_code])
    end

    @class Dorm begin
        dorm_id ~ Unmodeled()
        dorm_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:dorm_name])
        student_capacity ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:student_capacity])
        gender ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:gender])
    end

    @class Dorm_amenity begin
        dorm_amenity_amenity_id ~ Unmodeled()
        amenity_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:amenity_name])
    end

    @class Has_amenity begin
        dorm ~ Dorm
        dorm_amenity ~ Dorm_amenity
    end

    @class Lives_in begin
        student ~ Student
        dorm ~ Dorm
        room_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:room_number])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        has_amenity ~ Has_amenity
        lives_in ~ Lives_in
        @learned avg_age::Dict{String, MeanParameter{20.8, 3.1144823004794873}}
        unit_age ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        age_base = avg_age["$(lives_in.student.last_name)_$(lives_in.student.first_name)_$(lives_in.student.sex)_$(lives_in.student.city_code)"]
        age ~ TransformedGaussian(age_base, 3.1144823004794873/10, unit_age)
        age_corrected = round(unit_age.backward(age))
    end
end

PClean.@model JournalCommitteeModel begin

        date ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:date])

        name ~ MaybeSwap(journal_committee.editor.name, swap_possibilities["$(journal_committee.editor.age)-name"], error_prob_editor_id)

PClean.@model MedicineEnzymeInteractionModel begin

        location ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:location])
        product ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:product])
        chromosome ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:chromosome])
        porphyria ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:porphyria])
    end

    @class Medicine_enzyme_interaction begin
        enzyme ~ Enzyme
        medicine ~ Medicine
        interaction_type ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:interaction_type])

        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        medicine_name ~ Medicine_name

PClean.@model LocalGovtAndLotModel begin
    @class Things_service_type_code begin
        things_service_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:things_service_type_code])
    end

    @class Things begin
        things_thing_id ~ Unmodeled()
        organizations ~ Organizations
        type_of_thing_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:type_of_thing_code])
        things_service_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:things_service_details])
    end

    @class Customers begin
        customers_customer_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customer_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_details])
    end

    @class Properties begin
        properties_property_id ~ Unmodeled()
        property_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:property_type_code])
        property_address ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:property_address])
        properties_other_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:properties_other_details])
    end

    @class Residents begin
        residents_resident_id ~ Unmodeled()
        properties ~ Properties
        residents_date_moved_in ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:residents_date_moved_in])
        date_moved_out ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_moved_out])
        residents_other_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:residents_other_details])
    end

    @class Organizations begin
        organizations_organization_id ~ Unmodeled()
        parent_organization_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:parent_organization_id])
        organization_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:organization_details])
    end

    @class Services begin
        organizations ~ Organizations
        services_service_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:services_service_type_code])
        services_service_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:services_service_details])
    end

    @class Residents_services begin
        residents ~ Residents
        services ~ Services
        date_requested ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_requested])
        date_provided ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_provided])
        residents_services_other_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:residents_services_other_details])
    end

    @class Customer_events begin
        customer_events_customer_event_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customers ~ Customers
        residents ~ Residents
        things ~ Things
    end

    @class Customer_event_notes begin
        customer_event_note_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customer_events ~ Customer_events
        customer_event_notes_service_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_event_notes_service_type_code])
        customer_event_notes_resident_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_event_notes_resident_id])
        customer_event_notes_property_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_event_notes_property_id])
        customer_event_notes_date_moved_in ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:customer_event_notes_date_moved_in])
    end

    @class Timed_status_of_things begin
        things ~ Things
        date_and_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_and_date])
        status_of_thing_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:status_of_thing_code])
    end

    @class Timed_locations_of_things begin
        things ~ Things
        date_and_time ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_and_time])
        location_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:location_code])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        things_service_type_code ~ Things_service_type_code
        residents_services ~ Residents_services
        customer_event_notes ~ Customer_event_notes
        timed_status_of_things ~ Timed_status_of_things
        timed_locations_of_things ~ Timed_locations_of_things
        error_prob_things_service_type_code = error_probs[things_service_type_code.things_service_type_code]
        type_of_thing_code ~ MaybeSwap(timed_status_of_things.things.type_of_thing_code, swap_possibilities["$(timed_status_of_things.things.things_thing_id)-type_of_thing_code"], error_prob_things_service_type_code)
    end
end

Given this dataset excerpt and error description, the goal is to write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. 

A good first step is to describe the schema of the dataset, since the structure of the PClean program closely follows the dataset schema. Can you describe the schema of the given dataset, provided the excerpt above?

Yes! The following describes the schema: The schema has 4 tables, which we'll call train, station, route, and weekly_weather. The table train has columns train_id, train_number, name, origin, destination, time, and interval. The table station has columns station_id, network_name, services, and local_authority. The table route has columns train_id and route_station_id. The table weekly_weather has columns weekly_weather_station_id, day_of_week, high_temperature, low_temperature, precipitation, and wind_speed_mph. Finally, train_id of route is a foreign key reference to train_id of train, route_station_id of route is a foreign key reference to station_id of station, and weekly_weather_station_id of weekly_weather is a foreign key reference to station_id of station.

Awesome! Now, based on this schema and the previously provided error description, please write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. Please only include the PClean program in your response, without any preceding or following text.

PClean.@model StationWeatherModel begin
    @class Train_number begin
        train_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:train_number])
    end

    @class Train begin
        train_id ~ Unmodeled()
        name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:name])
        origin ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:origin])
        destination ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:destination])
        time ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:time])
        interval ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:interval])
    end

    @class Station begin
        station_id ~ Unmodeled()
        network_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:network_name])
        services ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:services])
        local_authority ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:local_authority])
    end

    @class Route begin
        train ~ Train
        station ~ Station
    end

    @class Weekly_weather begin
        station ~ Station
        day_of_week ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:day_of_week])
        high_temperature ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:high_temperature])
        low_temperature ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:low_temperature])
        precipitation ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:precipitation])
        wind_speed_mph ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:wind_speed_mph])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        train_number ~ Train_number
        route ~ Route
        weekly_weather ~ Weekly_weather
        error_prob_train_number = error_probs[train_number.train_number]
        name ~ MaybeSwap(route.train.name, swap_possibilities["$(route.train.destination)-name"], error_prob_train_number)
    end
end

PClean.@model ShopMembershipModel begin
    @class Hometown begin
        hometown ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:hometown])
    end

    @class Member begin
        member_id ~ Unmodeled()
        card_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:card_number])
        member_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:member_name])
        level ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:level])
    end

    @class Branch begin
        branch_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:branch_name])
        open_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:open_year])
        address_road ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:address_road])
        city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city])
        membership_amount ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:membership_amount])
    end

    @class Membership_register_branch begin
        member ~ Member
        branch ~ Branch
        register_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:register_year])
    end

    @class Purchase begin
        member ~ Member
        branch ~ Branch
        year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:year])
        total_pounds ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:total_pounds])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        hometown ~ Hometown
        membership_register_branch ~ Membership_register_branch
        purchase ~ Purchase
        error_prob_hometown = error_probs[hometown.hometown]
        level ~ MaybeSwap(membership_register_branch.member.level, swap_possibilities["$(membership_register_branch.member.member_id)-level"], error_prob_hometown)
    end
end

PClean.@model DrivingSchoolModel begin
    @class Lesson_time begin
        lesson_time ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:lesson_time])
    end

    @class Lessons begin
        lesson_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customers ~ Customers
        lesson_status_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:lesson_status_code])
        staff ~ Staff
        vehicles ~ Vehicles
        lesson_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:lesson_date])
        price ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:price])
    end

    @class Addresses begin
        address_id ~ Unmodeled()
        line_1_number_building ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:line_1_number_building])
        city ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:city])
        zip_postcode ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:zip_postcode])
        state_province_county ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:state_province_county])
        country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:country])
    end

    @class Staff begin
        staff_id ~ Unmodeled()
        addresses ~ Addresses
        nickname ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:nickname])
        staff_first_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:staff_first_name])
        middle_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:middle_name])
        staff_last_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:staff_last_name])
        staff_date_of_birth ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:staff_date_of_birth])
        date_joined_staff ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_joined_staff])
        date_left_staff ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_left_staff])
    end

    @class Vehicles begin
        vehicles_vehicle_id ~ Unmodeled()
        vehicle_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:vehicle_details])
    end

    @class Customers begin
        customers_customer_id ~ Unmodeled()
        addresses ~ Addresses
        customer_status_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_status_code])
        date_became_customer ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_became_customer])
        customers_date_of_birth ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:customers_date_of_birth])
        customers_first_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customers_first_name])
        customers_last_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customers_last_name])
        amount_outstanding ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:amount_outstanding])
        email_address ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:email_address])
        phone_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:phone_number])
        cell_mobile_phone_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:cell_mobile_phone_number])
    end

    @class Customer_payments begin
        customers ~ Customers
        datetime_payment ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:datetime_payment])
        payment_method_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:payment_method_code])
        amount_payment ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:amount_payment])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        lesson_time ~ Lesson_time
        customer_payments ~ Customer_payments
        lessons ~ Lessons
        error_prob_lesson_time = error_probs[lesson_time.lesson_time]
        state_province_county ~ AddTypos(lessons.customers.addresses.state_province_county, 2)
        country ~ AddTypos(lessons.customers.addresses.country, 2)
        price ~ MaybeSwap(lessons.price, swap_possibilities["$(lessons.lesson_id)-price"], error_prob_lesson_time)
    end
end

PClean.@model ConcertSingerModel begin

        singer_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:singer_name])

        song_release_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:song_release_year])
        age ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:age])
        is_male ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:is_male])

        stadium_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:stadium_name])
        capacity ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:capacity])
        highest ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:highest])
        lowest ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:lowest])
        average ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:average])
    end

    @class Concert begin

        concert_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:concert_name])
        theme ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:theme])
        stadium ~ Stadium
        year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:year])
    end

    @class Singer_in_concert begin
        concert ~ Concert
        singer ~ Singer
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        country ~ Country

        concert_name ~ AddTypos(singer_in_concert.concert.concert_name, 2)
    end
end

The table club has columns club_id, club_name, region, and start_year. The table club_rank has columns rank, club_rank_club_id, gold, silver, bronze, and total. The table player has columns player_id, player_name, position, player_club_id, apps, tries, goals, and points. The table competition has columns competition_id, year, competition_type, and country. The table competition_result has columns competition_result_competition_id, club_id_1, club_id_2, and score. Finally, club_rank_club_id of club_rank is a foreign key reference to club_id of club, player_club_id of player is a foreign key reference to club_id of club, club_id_2 of competition_result is a foreign key reference to club_id of club, club_id_1 of competition_result is a foreign key reference to club_id of club, and competition_result_competition_id of competition_result is a foreign key reference to competition_id of competition.

Awesome! Now, based on this schema and the previously provided error description, please write a PClean program that describes the schema of the dataset and the errors it contains. Please only include the PClean program in your response, without any preceding or following text.

PClean.@model SportsCompetitionModel begin
    @class Player_name begin
        player_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:player_name])
    end

    @class Player begin
        player_id ~ Unmodeled()
        position ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:position])
        club ~ Club
        apps ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:apps])
        tries ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:tries])
        goals ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:goals])
        points ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:points])
    end

    @class Club begin
        club_id ~ Unmodeled()
        club_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:club_name])
        region ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:region])
        start_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:start_year])
    end

    @class Club_rank begin
        rank ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:rank])
        club ~ Club
        gold ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:gold])
        silver ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:silver])
        bronze ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:bronze])
        total ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:total])
    end

    @class Competition begin
        competition_id ~ Unmodeled()
        year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:year])
        competition_type ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:competition_type])
        country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:country])
    end

    @class Competition_result begin
        competition ~ Competition
        club ~ Club
        score ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:score])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        player_name ~ Player_name
        club_rank ~ Club_rank
        player ~ Player
        competition_result ~ Competition_result
        error_prob_player_name = error_probs[player_name.player_name]
        start_year ~ AddTypos(club_rank.club.start_year, 2)
        goals ~ MaybeSwap(player.goals, swap_possibilities["$(player.tries)-goals"], error_prob_player_name)
        competition_type ~ AddTypos(competition_result.competition.competition_type, 2)
    end
end

PClean.@model Inn1Model begin
    @class Max_occupancy begin
        max_occupancy ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:max_occupancy])
    end

    @class Rooms begin
        room_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:room_id])
        room_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:room_name])
        beds ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:beds])
        bed_type ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:bed_type])
        base_price ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:base_price])
        decor ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:decor])
    end

    @class Reservations begin
        rooms ~ Rooms
        check_in ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:check_in])
        check_out ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:check_out])
        last_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:last_name])
        first_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:first_name])
        adults ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:adults])
        kids ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:kids])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        max_occupancy ~ Max_occupancy
        reservations ~ Reservations
        error_prob_max_occupancy = error_probs[max_occupancy.max_occupancy]
        decor ~ MaybeSwap(reservations.rooms.decor, swap_possibilities["$(reservations.rooms.room_name)-decor"], error_prob_max_occupancy)
        @learned avg_code::Dict{String, MeanParameter{12911.825, 1687.8180708786758}}
        unit_code ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        code_base = avg_code["$(reservations.room)_$(reservations.check_in)_$(reservations.check_out)_$(reservations.last_name)_$(reservations.first_name)"]
        code ~ TransformedGaussian(code_base, 1687.8180708786758/10, unit_code)
        code_corrected = round(unit_code.backward(code))
        @learned avg_rate::Dict{String, MeanParameter{171.59722222222223, 68.80119157702357}}
        unit_rate ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        rate_base = avg_rate["$(reservations.room)_$(reservations.check_in)_$(reservations.check_out)_$(reservations.last_name)_$(reservations.first_name)"]
        rate ~ TransformedGaussian(rate_base, 68.80119157702357/10, unit_rate)
        rate_corrected = round(unit_rate.backward(rate))
    end
end

The table mill has columns mill_architect_id, mill_id, mill_location, mill_name, type, built_year, and notes. PClean.@model ArchitectureModel begin
    @class Bridge_name begin
        bridge_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:bridge_name])
    end

    @class Bridge begin
        architect ~ Architect
        bridge_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:bridge_id])
        bridge_location ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:bridge_location])
        length_meters ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:length_meters])
        length_feet ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:length_feet])
    end

    @class Architect begin
        architect_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:architect_id])
        architect_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:architect_name])
        nationality ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:nationality])
        gender ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:gender])
    end

    @class Mill begin
        architect ~ Architect
        mill_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:mill_id])
        mill_location ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:mill_location])
        mill_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:mill_name])
        type ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:type])
        built_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:built_year])
        notes ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:notes])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        bridge_name ~ Bridge_name
        bridge ~ Bridge
        mill ~ Mill
        error_prob_bridge_name = error_probs[bridge_name.bridge_name]
        bridge_location ~ MaybeSwap(bridge.bridge_location, swap_possibilities["$(bridge.bridge_id)-bridge_location"], error_prob_bridge_name)
    end
end

PClean.@model Csu1Model begin
    @class Enrollments_year begin
        enrollments_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:enrollments_year])
    end

    @class Enrollments begin
        campuses ~ Campuses
        totalenrollment_ay ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:totalenrollment_ay])
        fte_ay ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:fte_ay])
    end

    @class Campuses begin
        id ~ Unmodeled()
        campuses_campus ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:campuses_campus])
        location ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:location])
        county ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:county])
        campuses_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:campuses_year])
    end

    @class Csu_fees begin
        campuses ~ Campuses
        csu_fees_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:csu_fees_year])
        campus_fee ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:campus_fee])
    end

    @class Degrees begin
        degrees_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:degrees_year])
        campuses ~ Campuses
        degrees ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:degrees])
    end

    @class Discipline_enrollments begin
        campuses ~ Campuses
        discipline ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:discipline])
        discipline_enrollments_year ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:discipline_enrollments_year])
        undergraduate ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:undergraduate])
        graduate ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:graduate])
    end

    @class Faculty begin
        campuses ~ Campuses
        faculty ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:faculty])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        enrollments_year ~ Enrollments_year
        csu_fees ~ Csu_fees
        degrees ~ Degrees
        discipline_enrollments ~ Discipline_enrollments
        enrollments ~ Enrollments
        faculty ~ Faculty
        error_prob_enrollments_year = error_probs[enrollments_year.enrollments_year]
        county ~ AddTypos(csu_fees.campuses.county, 2)
        fte_ay ~ MaybeSwap(enrollments.fte_ay, swap_possibilities["$(enrollments.totalenrollment_ay)-fte_ay"], error_prob_enrollments_year)
        @learned avg_faculty_year::Dict{String, MeanParameter{2003.0, 1.0}}
        unit_faculty_year ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        faculty_year_base = avg_faculty_year[""]
        faculty_year ~ TransformedGaussian(faculty_year_base, 1.0/10, unit_faculty_year)
        faculty_year_corrected = round(unit_faculty_year.backward(faculty_year))
    end
end

PClean.@model TrackingOrdersModel begin
    @class Customers begin
        customers_customer_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customer_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_name])
        customer_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_details])
    end

    @class Invoices begin
        invoices_invoice_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:invoices_invoice_number])
        invoice_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:invoice_date])
        invoice_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:invoice_details])
    end

    @class Orders begin
        customers ~ Customers
        order_status ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:order_status])
        date_order_placed ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_order_placed])
        order_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:order_details])
    end

    @class Products begin
        products_product_id ~ Unmodeled()
        product_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:product_name])
        product_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:product_details])
    end

    @class Order_items begin
        order_items_order_item_id ~ Unmodeled()
        products ~ Products
        orders ~ Orders
        order_item_status ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:order_item_status])
        order_item_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:order_item_details])
    end

    @class Shipments begin
        shipments_shipment_id ~ Unmodeled()
        orders ~ Orders
        invoices ~ Invoices
        shipment_tracking_number ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:shipment_tracking_number])
        shipment_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:shipment_date])
        other_shipment_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:other_shipment_details])
    end

    @class Shipment_items begin
        shipments ~ Shipments
        order_items ~ Order_items
    end

    @class Obs begin
        shipment_items ~ Shipment_items
        order_details ~ AddTypos(shipment_items.shipments.orders.order_details, 2)
    end
end

PClean.@model InsurancePoliciesModel begin
    @class Customers begin
        customers_customer_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customer_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_details])
    end

        customer_policies_policy_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customers ~ Customers
        policy_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:policy_type_code])
        start_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:start_date])
        end_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:end_date])
    end

    @class Claims begin
        claims_claim_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customer_policies ~ Customer_policies
        claims_date_claim_made ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:claims_date_claim_made])
        claims_date_claim_settled ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:claims_date_claim_settled])
        claims_amount_claimed ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:claims_amount_claimed])
        claims_amount_settled ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:claims_amount_settled])
    end

    @class Settlements begin
        settlements_settlement_id ~ Unmodeled()
        claims ~ Claims
        settlements_date_claim_made ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:settlements_date_claim_made])
        settlements_date_claim_settled ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:settlements_date_claim_settled])
        settlements_amount_claimed ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:settlements_amount_claimed])
        customer_policy_id ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_policy_id])
    end

    @class Payments begin
        payment_id ~ Unmodeled()
        settlements ~ Settlements
        payment_method_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:payment_method_code])
        date_payment_made ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_payment_made])
        amount_payment ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:amount_payment])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        payments ~ Payments
        customer_details ~ AddTypos(payments.settlements.claims.customer_policies.customers.customer_details, 2)
        @learned avg_settlements_amount_settled::Dict{String, MeanParameter{1492.111111111111, 331.5846213428951}}

        settlements_amount_settled_corrected = round(unit_settlements_amount_settled.backward(settlements_amount_settled))
    end
end

The table premises has columns premises_premise_id, premises_type, and premise_details. The table products has columns products_product_id, products_product_category, and product_name. The table customers has columns customers_customer_id, payment_method, customer_name, customer_phone, customer_email, customer_address, customer_login, and customer_password. The table mailshot_campaigns has columns mailshot_campaigns_mailshot_id, mailshot_campaigns_product_category, mailshot_name, mailshot_start_date, and mailshot_end_date. The table customer_addresses has columns customer_addresses_customer_id, customer_addresses_premise_id, date_address_from, address_type_code, and date_address_to. The table mailshot_customers has columns mailshot_customers_mailshot_id, mailshot_customers_customer_id, outcome_code, and mailshot_customer_date. The table order_items has columns item_id, order_item_status_code, order_items_order_id, order_items_product_id, item_status_code, item_delivered_datetime, and item_order_quantity. Finally, customer_addresses_premise_id of customer_addresses is a foreign key reference to premises_premise_id of premises, customer_addresses_customer_id of customer_addresses is a foreign key reference to customers_customer_id of customers, customer_orders_customer_id of customer_orders is a foreign key reference to customers_customer_id of customers, mailshot_customers_customer_id of mailshot_customers is a foreign key reference to customers_customer_id of customers, order_items_order_id of order_items is a foreign key reference to customer_orders_order_id of customer_orders, mailshot_customers_mailshot_id of mailshot_customers is a foreign key reference to mailshot_campaigns_mailshot_id of mailshot_campaigns, and order_items_product_id of order_items is a foreign key reference to products_product_id of products.

PClean.@model CustomersCampaignsEcommerceModel begin
    @class Customer_name begin
        customer_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_name])
    end

    @class Customers begin
        customers_customer_id ~ Unmodeled()
        payment_method ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:payment_method])
        customer_phone ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_phone])
        customer_email ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_email])
        customer_address ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_address])
        customer_login ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_login])
        customer_password ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:customer_password])
    end

    @class Premises begin
        premises_premise_id ~ Unmodeled()
        premises_type ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:premises_type])
        premise_details ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:premise_details])
    end

    @class Products begin
        products_product_category ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:products_product_category])
        product_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:product_name])
    end

    @class Mailshot_campaigns begin
        mailshot_campaigns_mailshot_id ~ Unmodeled()
        mailshot_campaigns_product_category ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:mailshot_campaigns_product_category])
        mailshot_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:mailshot_name])
        mailshot_start_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:mailshot_start_date])
        mailshot_end_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:mailshot_end_date])
    end

    @class Customer_addresses begin
        customers ~ Customers
        premises ~ Premises
        date_address_from ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_address_from])
        address_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:address_type_code])
        date_address_to ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:date_address_to])
    end

    @class Customer_orders begin
        customer_orders_order_id ~ Unmodeled()
        customers ~ Customers
        order_status_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:order_status_code])
        shipping_method_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:shipping_method_code])
        order_placed_datetime ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:order_placed_datetime])
        order_delivered_datetime ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:order_delivered_datetime])
        order_shipping_charges ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:order_shipping_charges])
    end

    @class Mailshot_customers begin
        mailshot_campaigns ~ Mailshot_campaigns
        customers ~ Customers
        outcome_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:outcome_code])
        mailshot_customer_date ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:mailshot_customer_date])
    end

    @class Order_items begin
        item_id ~ Unmodeled()
        order_item_status_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:order_item_status_code])
        customer_orders ~ Customer_orders
        products ~ Products
        item_status_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:item_status_code])
        item_delivered_datetime ~ TimePrior(possibilities[:item_delivered_datetime])
        item_order_quantity ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:item_order_quantity])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        customer_name ~ Customer_name
        customer_addresses ~ Customer_addresses
        mailshot_customers ~ Mailshot_customers
        order_items ~ Order_items
        error_prob_customer_name = error_probs[customer_name.customer_name]
        customer_phone ~ MaybeSwap(customer_addresses.customers.customer_phone, swap_possibilities["$(customer_addresses.customers.customer_email)-customer_phone"], error_prob_customer_name)
    end
end

PClean.@model MountainPhotosModel begin
    @class Country begin
        country ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:country])
    end

    @class Mountain begin
        mountain_id ~ Unmodeled()
        mountain_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:mountain_name])
        prominence ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:prominence])
        range ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:range])
    end

    @class Camera_lens begin
        camera_lens_id ~ Unmodeled()
        brand ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:brand])
        camera_lens_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:camera_lens_name])
        focal_length_mm ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:focal_length_mm])
        max_aperture ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:max_aperture])
    end

    @class Photos begin
        camera_lens ~ Camera_lens
        mountain ~ Mountain
        color ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:color])
        photos_name ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:photos_name])
    end

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        country ~ Country
        photos ~ Photos
        error_prob_country = error_probs[country.country]
        mountain_name ~ MaybeSwap(photos.mountain.mountain_name, swap_possibilities["$(photos.mountain.mountain_id)-mountain_name"], error_prob_country)
        @learned avg_height::Dict{String, MeanParameter{4103.0, 124.38488654173383}}
        unit_height ~ ChooseUniformly(units)
        height_base = avg_height["$(photos.mountain.mountain_name)_$(photos.mountain.range)_$(photos.mountain.country)"]
        height ~ TransformedGaussian(height_base, 124.38488654173383/10, unit_height)
        height_corrected = round(unit_height.backward(height))
    end
end

]

    @class Obs begin
        @learned error_probs::Dict{String, ProbParameter{10.0, 50.0}}
        result ~ Result

        disposition_of_ship ~ AddTypos(death.ship.disposition_of_ship, 2)
    end
end

PClean.@model CreDocControlSystemsModel begin
    @class Reference_document_types begin
        reference_document_types_document_type_code ~ ChooseUniformly(possibilities[:reference_document_types_document_type_code])
